newsitem.title: GERMANY: Reuters German Advertising & Media Digest - Apr 30.
newsitem.headline: Reuters German Advertising & Media Digest - Apr 30.

text.p: REUTERS GERMAN ADVERTISING & MEDIA DIGEST
News from Reuters and the German press on Advertising, Marketing, Brand-name Products, Consumer Trends, Media and the Internet.
ADVERTISING & MARKETING:
HAMBURG - Advertising agency Baader, Lang, Behnken says it plans to demerge from the German unit of ad group Ammirati Puris Lintas after nine years and buy back its majority shares. (Reuter)

BONN - Mercedes-Benz AG, famous for its luxury cars and limos, has announced an uncharacteristically glitzy scheme to launch its new A-class compact. The venerable company plans a touring road show complete with dancers inside a six-storey-high steel cube. (Reuter)

BONN - German leaders in politics, the media, industry and associations put little faith in advertising as a source of information, an industry survey shows. Among those surveyed by public relations agency Kohtes and Klewes and Emnid research institute, 71 percent said they receive direct-marketing materials from companies but only 12 percent use them as a source of information. (Reuter)
FRANKFURT - Battery manufacturer Duracell, a Gillette unit, has awarded its $30 million media account for Europe to Ogilvy & Mathers The Network. (Horizont)
MEDIA & THE INTERNET:

BONN - Telecommunications group Deutsche Telekom AG is willing to allow competition in the distribution of digital television programming in its cable network, a report in the Sueddeutsche Zeitung newspaper says. In negotiations with television stations and private cable companies, Telekom reportedly gave up its demand for a marketing and subscription monopoly. (Reuter)

DUESSELDORF - Magazine publishing group Gruner & Jahr AG & Co, a subsidiary of Bertlesmann AG, says it plans to cut its initial losses for the current fiscal year by 50 million marks ($29 million). (Reuter)

MUNICH - About a third of German teenagers say electronic media have more influence over the rising generation than parents or teachers, a poll published by the B.A.T. recreation research institute. (Reuter)
BRAND-NAME PRODUCTS & MARKETS:
FRANKFURT - Comdirect bank GmbH, a unit of banking group Commerzbank AG, says it has doubled its number of customers since the beginning of 1996 to 83,000 but remains in the red. (Reuter)
COLOGNE - The Association of German Retailers says the turnover of specialty shops sank another two percent in March. (Reuter)
HAMBURG - Restaurant chain Wienerwald GmbH says it does not plan to build additional locations in the near future, in order to focus capital in existing restaurants. (Reuter)

FRANKFURT - Mobile phone service group MobilCom AG says its made a profit on ordinary activities of 5.4 million marks for the first quarter of the year, more than double what it was expecting. (Reuter)
PEOPLE NEWS:

MUNICH - Electronics firm Grundig confirms its chairman Christian Schwarz-Schilling will step down. Grundig says Schwarz-Schilling has asked the former chairman of munitions manufacturer Krauss-Maffei AG, Burkhard Wollschlaeger, to replace him. (Reuter)
FRANKFURT - Ernst Schulte has been named the new managing director of marketing, food and drinks at the Union Deutsche Lebensmittelwerke GmbH. (Horizont)
Deborah Cole, Berlin Newsroom, 49-30-20398114
